title: Thursday the thirteenth of August, 1657. At the Council at VVhite-hall. His Highness the Lord Protector and his Privy Council, taking notice of the hand of God, which at this time is gone out against this nation, in the present visitation by sickness that is much spread over the land, ...
author: England and Wales. Lord Protector (1653-1658 : O. Cromwell)
publisher: Printed by Henry Hills and John Field, Printers to His Highness the Lord Protector,
notes: Title from caption and first lines of text.
Signed: Hen: Scobell, Clerk of the Council.
Friday, 21 August, appointed a day of humiliation for London, &c. in view of the present sickness. -- Cf. Steele.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
